post.description: Checks if CI/CD YAML configuration is valid. This endpoint validates basic CI/CD configuration syntax. It doesn’t have any namespace-specific context.

parameters.name: include_merged_yaml
parameters.description: If the expanded CI/CD configuration should be included in the response.

parameters.name: include_jobs
parameters.description: If the list of jobs should be included in the response. This is false by default.

post.summary: Validate a CI YAML configuration with a namespace
post.description: Checks if CI/CD YAML configuration is valid. This endpoint has namespace specific context.

parameters.name: dry_run
parameters.description: Run pipeline creation simulation, or only do static check. This is false by default.

parameters.name: include_jobs
parameters.description: If the list of jobs that would exist in a static check or pipeline simulation should be included in the response. This is false by default.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: When dry_run is true, sets the branch or tag to use. Defaults to the project’s default branch when not set.

get.description: Checks if a project’s latest (HEAD of the project’s default branch) .gitlab-ci.yml configuration is valid. This endpoint uses all namespace specific data available, including variables, local includes, and so on.

parameters.name: dry_run
parameters.description: Run pipeline creation simulation, or only do static check.

parameters.name: include_jobs
parameters.description: If the list of jobs that would exist in a static check or pipeline simulation should be included in the response. This is false by default.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: When dry_run is true, sets the branch or tag to use. Defaults to the project’s default branch when not set.
